name: tottering
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
walking with difficulty in a way that looks as if you are about to fall: One picture was of a tottering 89-year-old leaving the platform after her conference speech. She walked slowly with tottering steps.
shaking and moving from side to side, and likely to fall: It is now so easy to buy books over the internet that the average home is bursting with tottering piles of paperbacks. They lived in tottering shacks made from mud, bricks and breeze blocks.
becoming weaker, and likely to fail or end: It was the last decision of a tottering government. See
totter
More examplesFewer examplesNo one in the cars had seen the tottering figure further down the road. One self-portrait includes a tottering chair on which she seems to be precariously balancing.He flew to New Hampshire vowing to rescue his tottering campaign.Four tottering banks have been rescued by state companies in the past month.
